newsitem.title: USA: Playboy to launch networks in Latin America.
newsitem.headline: Playboy to launch networks in Latin America.

text.p: Playboy Entereprises Inc said Tuesday it is joining with Cisneros Television Group to launch two new television networks, Playboy TV/Latin America and AdulTVision/Latin America.
Both services will be part of a new venture called Playboy TV Latin America LLC.

Cisneros Television Group is a division of the Cisneros Group of Cos, which owns and operates television stations throughout Latin America. Cisneros holds an 81 percent interest in the new venture and Playboy holds the remaining interest.
Playboy, a media and entertainment company, also will get license fees for the programming and royalty fees for use of the Playboy brand name for pay television.
Playboy and AdulTVision initially will be offered on an exclusive basis by Galaxy Latin America, a 144-channel direct-to-home satellite service.
Playboy chairman Christie Hefner said the new network will complement the company's international networks in the United Kingdom and Japan.
